alert.note: Alert for West Elk and Sawatch Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 5:20PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...SNOW SQUALL... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 520 PM MDT, a snow squall was along a line extending from 20 miles west of Craig to 18 miles south of Meeker to near Grand Junction and moving southeast at 40 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Grand Junction, Glenwood Springs, Craig, Fruita, Rifle, New Castle, Orchard City, Silt, Palisade, Meeker, Cedaredge, Hayden, Parachute, Collbran, De Beque, Mesa, Rio Blanco, Battlement Mesa, Cameo and Lay. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 27 and 124. U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 59 and 111. Colorado 13 between mile markers 1 and 92. Colorado 64 between mile markers 64 and 73. Colorado 65 between mile markers 6 and 61. Colorado 82 between mile markers 1 and 8. Colorado 92 between mile markers 11 and 14. Colorado 139 between mile markers 2 and 9. Colorado 141 between mile markers 160 and 162. Colorado 318 near mile marker 60. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
